title: CoderDojo @ Thomson Reuters Geneva 26th of May 2018
description:
Participants:                Enfants entre 6 ans et 16 ans. Présence d’un adulte obligatoire.

Date:                           Le samedi 26 Mai 2018 de 9:00 a 12:30

Lieu:                            Thomson Reuters, Route de Thonon 153, 1245 Collonge Bellerive

Inscription:                  Merci d’envoyer un courriel a CoderDojo.GVA@tr.com en indiquant le nom et l’âge de votre/vos enfant(s). Nombre de participants limité.

Equipement:                Merci d’apporter un ordinateur portable. Ordinateur a disposition sur demande en quantité limitée.

Modules au choix:       HTLM, Scratch

                                    Un certificat sera remis a la fin de la session

title: Game programming
description:
No prior knowledge required.

This time we'll explore some basic programming but in a visual fashion rather than text editors and bare bone Javascript code.

Parents: Please contribute with the donation box to help us keep running this free of charge for those who can't actually afford it. Thanks for your generosity.

If you have any question please drop us a line to fromecoderdojo@gmail.com

You'll need a laptop to do the coding exercises.

We aim to get 10 people. Booking does not guarantees you a place, we anticipate oversubscribing so people may be chosen randomly.

This is a volunteering effort but we do appreciate a contributions to cover venue's costs and refreshments. Suggested £5 

Instructors  :  Felipe & Agustin

http://fromecoderdojo.org

We reserve the right to cancel it at any time, we'll notify you should that happen of course.

Parents are welcome to help facilitating the event.

location.address: Edventure Frome, Welsh Mill, Park Hill Drive, Frome, BA112LE, UK.

title: May CoderDojo
description:
It's the May CoderDojo!

Come along and learn to code in a fun and creative environment. CoderDojo mentors will be on hand to give advice and help. You can bring your own project, or take part in one of the activities.

What will we be doing?

Scratch - an easy and interactive way to learn to think like a coder. There are lots of different levels you can try your hand at and improve your code ninja skills! 

Html & JavaScript - fancy coding your own emoji AND animating it? Give this one a try!

MakeyMakey - Put your invention cap on! It's a simple Invention Kit for Beginners and Experts doing art, engineering, and everything in-between: if you'd like to set up a banana piano, or build a Hungry Hippo drum-machine, this is for you!

If you have your own project or would like to try something different (python, Raspberry Pi, etc), please let us know!

 

Please bring:

A parent or guardian! (Very important) Your parent/guardian must stay with you for the duration of the session.

We'll provide snack for all the children - please let us know about any dietary requirements in advance.

location.address:
OVO 
1 Rivergate, Temple Quay, Bristol BS1 6ED
